The music was written as the theme for the little-known prison film â€œUnchainedâ€ (January 1955), hence the song title. Todd Duncan sang the vocals for the film soundtrack. It has since become a standard and one of the most recorded songs of the 20th century, most notably by the Righteous Brothers. The movie â€œUnchainedâ€ is about a man in prison and longing for his wife and children. Hoping his wife will still be there when he gets out. So you can now understand the meaning of the song. The movie was not very good, or so my friends told me. But we were all teenagers so what did we know. Several artists sang it and it made the billboard top 100. But no one can come close to Bobby Hatfieldâ€™s version. Bobbyâ€™s version hit the top ten chart. And did it again when it was used in the movie â€œGhostâ€ It has since become a standard and one of the most recorded songs of the 20th century, most notably by Bobby.
